intro: Pittocaulon praecox, commonly known as the early pittocaulon, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
